info.description: Create plugins that connect MailChimp to your CMS, your blog, your e-commerce shopping cart, and more.
info.title: MailChimp

get.description: Retrieve various templates available in the system, allowing some thing similar to our template gallery to be created.

parameters.description: The types of templates to return. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/templates.func.php"
parameters.name: types

parameters.description: For Gallery templates only, limit to a specific template category.
parameters.name: category

parameters.description: Options to control how inactive templates are returned, if at all. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/templates.func.php"
parameters.name: inactives

parameters.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.
parameters.name: dc

parameters.description: a valid api key for your user account.
parameters.name: apikey

parameters.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.
parameters.name: method

parameters.description: output formats for serialized calls.
parameters.name: output

parameters.name: output

get.description: Retrieve all of the lists defined for your user account.

parameters.description: A hash of filters to apply to this query. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/lists.func.php"
parameters.name: filters

parameters.description: Control paging of lists, start results at this list #, defaults to 1st page of data (page 0).
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: Control paging of lists, number of lists to return with each call, defaults to 25 (max=100).
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.
parameters.name: dc

parameters.description: a valid api key for your user account.
parameters.name: apikey

parameters.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.
parameters.name: method

parameters.description: output formats for serialized calls.
parameters.name: output

parameters.name: actions

parameters.description: A hash of sources to fire this Webhook. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/listwebhookadd.func.php"

get.description: Edit the email address, merge fields, and interest groups for a list member.

parameters.description: The list id to connect.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The current email address of the member to update OR the "id" for the member returned from listMemberInfo, Webhooks, and Campaigns.
parameters.name: email_address

parameters.description: Array of new field values to update the member with. See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/listsubscribe.func.php"
parameters.name: merge_vars

parameters.description: Change the email type preference for the member. Leave blank to keep the existing preference (optional).
parameters.name: email_type

parameters.description: Flag to determine whether we replace the interest groups with the updated groups provided, or we add the provided groups to the member's interest groups.
parameters.name: replace_interests

parameters.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.
parameters.name: dc

parameters.description: a valid api key for your user account.
parameters.name: apikey

parameters.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.
parameters.name: method

parameters.description: output formats for serialized calls.
parameters.name: output

get.description: Unsubscribe the given email address from the list.

parameters.description: The list id to connect.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The email address to unsubscribe OR the email "id" returned from listMemberInfo, Webhooks, and Campaigns.
parameters.name: email_address

parameters.description: Flag to completely delete the member from your list instead of just unsubscribing.
parameters.name: delete_member

parameters.description: Flag to send the goodbye email to the email address.
parameters.name: send_goodbye

parameters.description: Flag to send the unsubscribe notification email to the address defined in the list email notification settings.
parameters.name: send_notify

parameters.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.
parameters.name: dc

parameters.description: a valid api key for your user account.
parameters.name: apikey

parameters.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.
parameters.name: method

parameters.description: output formats for serialized calls.
parameters.name: output

get.description: Subscribe the provided email to a list. By default this sends a confirmation email.

parameters.description: The list id to connect.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The email address to subscribe.
parameters.name: email_address

parameters.description: Merges for the email (FNAME, LNAME, etc.). See options: "http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/listsubscribe.func.php"
parameters.name: merge_vars

parameters.description: Email type preference for the email.
parameters.name: email_type

parameters.description: Flag to control whether a double opt-in confirmation message is sent, defaults to true. Abusing this may cause your account to be suspended.
parameters.name: double_optin

parameters.description: Flag to control whether existing subscribers should be updated instead of throwing an error.
parameters.name: update_existing

parameters.description: Flag to determine whether we replace the interest groups with the groups provided or we add the provided groups to the member's interest groups.
parameters.name: replace_interests

parameters.description: If your double_optin is false and this is true, we will send your lists Welcome Email if this subscribe succeeds - this will *not* fire if we end up updating an existing subscriber. If double_optin is true, this has no effect.
parameters.name: send_welcome

parameters.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.
parameters.name: dc

parameters.description: a valid api key for your user account.
parameters.name: apikey

parameters.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.
parameters.name: method

parameters.description: output formats for serialized calls.
parameters.name: output

parameters.description: The list id to connect.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The merge tag to add, e.g. FNAME. 10 bytes max, valid characters: "A-Z 0-9 _" no spaces, dashes, etc.
parameters.name: tag

parameters.description: The long description of the tag being added, used for user displays.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Various options for this merge var. See options: http://apidocs.mailchimp.com/api/1.3/listmergevaradd.func.php
parameters.name: options

get.description: Get all of the list members for a list that are of a particular status.

parameters.description: The list id to connect.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: The status to get members.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Pull all members whose status (subscribed/unsubscribed/cleaned) has changed or whose profile (updated) has changed since this date/time (in GMT) - format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss (24hr).
parameters.name: since

parameters.description: For large data sets, the page number to start at - defaults to 1st page of data (page 0).
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: For large data sets, the number of results to return - defaults to 100, upper limit set at 15000.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.
parameters.name: dc

parameters.description: a valid api key for your user account.
parameters.name: apikey

parameters.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.
parameters.name: method

parameters.description: output formats for serialized calls.
parameters.name: output

For backwards compatibility, if a string is passed, it will be treated as an array with a single element (will not work with XML-RPC).

parameters.name: apikey

get.description: Update an existing Interest Grouping.

parameters.description: The interest grouping id.
parameters.name: grouping_id

parameters.description: The name of the field to update - either "name" or "type". Groups with in the grouping should be manipulated using the standard listInterestGroup methods.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: The new value of the field. Grouping names must be unique - only "hidden" and "checkboxes" grouping types can be converted between each other.

parameters.description: The interest grouping to add - grouping names must be unique.

parameters.description: The type of the grouping to add.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The lists of initial group names to be added - at least 1 is required and the names must be unique within a grouping. If the number takes you over the 60 group limit, an error will be thrown.
parameters.name: groups

parameters.description: For items in the options array, this will be that parameter's name (subject, from_email, etc.). Additional parameters will be that option name (content, segment_opts). "type_opts" will be the name of the type - rss, auto, trans, etc.

parameters.description: For items in the options array, this will be that parameter's value. For additional parameters, this is the same value passed to them.
parameters.name: value

parameters.description: the portion after the dash in your api key. e.g. "us1", "us2", "uk1", etc.

parameters.description: a valid api key for your user account.
parameters.name: apikey

parameters.description: is the method name from our api you are calling.
parameters.name: method

parameters.description: output formats for serialized calls.
parameters.name: output
